description:
Borrowed from Middle French designation, from Latin designatio.
Morphologically designate +â€Ž -ion

entries.meaning: An act or instance of designating; a pointing out or showing; indication.
Selection and appointment for a purpose or office; allotment; direction.
examples: His designation as chief justice was controversial.

entries.meaning: That which designates; a distinguishing mark or name; distinctive title; appellation.
signification, meaning, for example of a word or phrase.
examples: It doesn't list all the connotations that the term may have in various contexts: it specifies the designation of the term, or one of the designations of the term.
